IN.IC: je oblika za sedanjik, preteklik in pretekli deležnik.

sense.def:
To let something happen
pomeni dovoliti, da se nekaj zgodi.

seg.quote: People here sit back and let everyone else do the work.
She kept lifting handfuls of sand and letting it pour through her fingers.

sense.def:
To let someone do something
pomeni nekomu dati dovoljenje, da nekaj stori.

seg.quote: My parents wouldn't let me go out with boys.

sense.def:
To let someone in, out, or through
pomeni omogočiti, da gre nekdo noter, ven ali mimo.

seg.quote: ‘I rang the bell,’ Rudolph said, ‘and your friend let me in.’
I asked him to stop the car and let me out.

sense.def:
Izraz
let
uporabimo, kadar nekaj predlagamo, priporočamo ali prosimo.

seg.quote: If she insists on going so early, let her take a taxi.

sense.def:
Izraz
let's
ali
let us
uporabimo, kadar nekaj predlagamo.

seg.quote: Let us give her one more chance.

sense.def:
To let one's house or land to someone
pomeni nekomu dovoliti, da uporablja našo hišo ali zemljo v zameno za redno plačilo.

To let go of someone or something
pomeni prenehati nekoga ali nekaj držati.

Kadar rečemo, da nekaj ni tako, kot je videti,
let alone something else
, hočemo povedati, da prva stvar ni taka, zato tudi druga ne more biti, ker je težavnejša, bolj zapletena ali bolj nenavadna.

seg.quote: I had never seen him, let alone spoken to him.

sense.def:
To let someone down
pomeni nekoga razočarati, navadno zato, ker ne storimo tistega, kar smo obljubili.

To let down something filled with air
pomeni dovoliti, da zrak uide iz nečesa, na primer iz avtomobilske gume.

Kadar nekaj
lets in water or air
, ima luknjo ali razpoko, zaradi katere v notranjost prodre voda ali zrak.

seg.quote: My old boots had been letting in water.

sense.def:
To let oneself in for
pomeni misliti, da se je nekdo morda zapletel v nekaj težavnega ali neprijetnega;

seg.quote: What have we let ourselves in for?

form.orth:
let in on
ali
let into.

sense.def:
To let someone in on a secret
ali
to let someone into a secret
pomeni nekomu povedati skrivnost.

To let someone off a duty or task
pomeni nekomu reči, da mu ni treba opraviti dolžnosti ali naloge.

seg.quote: We have been let off our homework.

sense.def:
To let someone off
pomeni nekomu ne naložiti kazni ali mu naložiti manj strogo kazen, kot pričakuje.

cit.quote: izpustiti brez kazni ali z manjšo kaznijo; pogledati skozi prste

seg.quote: He let me off with a reprimand.

sense.def:
To let off a gun or a bomb
pomeni ustreliti s puško ali povzročiti, da bomba eksplodira.

Not to let on about something secret
pomeni nikomur ne povedati za nekaj skrivnega.

Kadar nekaj
lets up
, preneha ali postane manjše.

seg.quote: Day followed day and still the heat did not let up.
